Tags legs as home or work if they're close enough to either :param leg_index: index of the leg to be processed :type leg_index: int :param legs: list of legs :type legs: list(???) :param home_user: user's home location :type home_user: (latitude, longitude) :param work_user: user's work location :type work_user: (latitude, longitude)
mobilipy.poi_detection.assign_cell(latitude, longitude, cell_size=0.2)

` Assigns a cell_number based on the cantor pairing function and discretization into 25km * 25km cells. :param latitude: latitude in degrees. :type latitude: float :param longitude: longitude in degrees. :type longitude: float

Returns

cell_number (int) – Cell number based on the cantor pair function.

mobilipy.poi_detection.detect_home_work(legs, waypoints, cell_size=0.2)

Detects home and work locations, tags them with ‘Home’ or ‘Work’ in the df

Parameters

  • legs (list()) – list of legs

  • waypoints (pandas.DataFrame) – the waypoints DataFrame to be processed

mobilipy.poi_detection.find_centroid(leg_index, legs, home_user, work_user)

Tags legs as home or work if they’re close enough to either :param leg_index: index of the leg to be processed :type leg_index: int :param legs: list of legs :type legs: list(???) :param home_user: user’s home location :type home_user: (latitude, longitude) :param work_user: user’s work location :type work_user: (latitude, longitude)
